intro: Aequatorium juninense, commonly known as the Junín water lily, is a species of aquatic plant native to South America, particularly found in the Andean lakes of Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the family Nymphaeaceae and is characterized by its floating leaves and showy white flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often forming dense mats on the water surface. Its botanical features include thick, waxy leaves that help it float and specialized structures for underwater pollination.
